comment._content: Quite a contrast to a modern baseball audience picture. -- Seen on your photo stream. (?)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Another Bain/LOC photo of Governor Tenor throwing out the first ball at Ebbets Field: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5208799757/] National League President (and Pennsylvania Governor) throws out the first ball in the first game of the season at Ebbetts Field in Brooklyn, April 14, 1914. The Dodgers beat the Braves that day. Cold weather kept the crowd down to about 12,000. "Dodgers Win 8 to 2; Gov. Tener Throws Out Ball" Story in The New York Times, April 15, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9E03EFD91E39E6... Another Bain/LOC photo of Tener, at a baseball game: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4370887822/]

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Wystan:  Thanks for the information on Gov. Tener and the connection to the other photograph. We will add some of it to the information when we update the database.
